data.meta_description:
32 likes, 3 comments - tea_and_empathy on April 20, 2024: "The play is Eugene O’Neill’s last play and it’s largely autobiographical. 

O’Neill is Edmund, the younger son, who is the poet and also has consumption in the play. 

Like James Tyrone Snr ( Brian Cox) O’Neill’s Father was also an Irish, Catholic alcoholic and a Broadway actor and like Mary ( Patricia Clarkson) O’Neill’s Mother was a morphine addict. 

The play, published posthumously, represents O’Neill’s last words to the literary world. 

The play isn’t condemning in any way, no character is particularly worse than another and this is the play’s strength- it is fair and unbiased- all the characters have flaws which can be seen as positives when viewed through a different lens. 

We watch this family and notice the communication has broken down.

As the men get more drunk and fight about Mary’s addiction, no one in the family is willing to confront her. 

The experience in watching is of a journey in which we move forward in time as well as backwards into the past. 

We watch a family slowly sliding further into despair by their attachments to the past which they cannot forget or forgive.

The play’s tragedy is in the hopelessness we, alongside the family, feel for their future. 

It’s slow and fragmented, we watch a family disintegrating, it’s a very heavy watch.

The design by Lizzie Clachan is beautifully stripped back and the lighting by Jack Knowles is incredible- at one point it’s almost as dark on stage as it is in the auditorium- very atmospheric. 

A family convene at their summer house. It’s gloomy. The play has 4 long acts, (3.5 hours) it’s all talking and no action - in fact minimal movement .

It’s fair to say it is Patricia Clarkson as Mary, the wife and Mother, who has just returned from a sanatorium and is fast tumbling back into her addiction, who is palpably vulnerable and completely shines in this production. 

#longdaysjourneyintonight #eugeneoneill #playwright #jeremyherrin #director #jackknowles #lighting #lizzieclachan #design #costume #tomgibbons #sound #wyndhamstheatre".
